conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, C and D.
Predict which container (E or F) it will flow into after passing through baffles.
The liquid flows from the top through the openings labeled A, B, C, and D.
Each opening is connected to a baffle that directs the flow downward.
The liquid flows through opening A and follows the yellow baffle.
The liquid flows through opening B and follows the green baffle.
The liquid flows through opening C and follows the cyan baffle.
The liquid flows through opening D and follows the light blue baffle.

premise: The leftmost and center-left flows (from A and B) are directed towards container E.
conclusion: Liquid from openings A and B will flow into container E.

premise: The center-right and rightmost flows (from C and D) are directed towards container F.
conclusion: Liquid from openings C and D will flow into container F.

premise: Liquid from openings A and B will flow into container E. Liquid from openings C and D will flow into container F.
conclusion: Container E will receive liquid from A and B. Container F will receive liquid from C and D.
